intro: Hieracium profugum, commonly known as the wandering hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. Hieracium profugum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands.
